person.persName: Samuel Thomas Hauser, Sr. (Falmouth, Pendleton County, Kentucky, attorney and county judge)

body.p: Falmouth, Pendleton County, Kentucky, attorney and county judge. Bethania, North Carolina, native. Married to Mary Ann Kennett Hauser on March 21, 1822. Father of Samuel T. Hauser, Jr, Emeline Hauser, Theodosia Hauser, Henry D. Hauser, Richard D. Hauser. Attorney in Pendleton County in 1850. Owned twelve slaves in Pendleton County in 1850. Presiding Judge of the Pendleton County Court in Pendleton County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1860.
